The pressure on an international footballer is always immense. 
For many, the best way to go about their business would be to keep their head down, work hard on the training field, perform on the pitch come matchday and have a nice, peaceful private life as you rest and recuperate. 
Then repeat for 10 or 15 years, enjoy your retirement, and look back proudly at how you got through your football career. 
It appears Jiang Zhipeng didn't get that memo, however. Jiang Zhipeng controlling a ball better than he does his private life (Photo: Anadolu/Getty Images) 
In front of a whopping 100,000 fans in Iran's Azadi Stadium on Tuesday, China fell to a 1-0 defeat against the hosts in a qualifier which ended their hopes of reaching the World Cup finals next summer. 
The only goal of the game was scored by Mehdi Taremi, who hit home early in the second half after left-back Zhipeng bizarrely nodded the ball into his bath in a shocking attempt at a clearance: Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
Zhipeng's day soon went from bad to worse, however. 
After the game, his wife Zhang Zhiyue took to social media platform Weibo to reveal he had been cheating on her throughout their four-year marriage. 
"I supported him when he was still a poor lad and my mum treated him like her own son," she explained. 
"We didn't have a wedding ceremony and our relationship was never made public. In nearly three-and-a-half-years out of our four-year marriage, he was sleeping with other women and now he is trying to drive me to an early grave despite our decades-long relationship." 
Oh dear. And it gets worse still. 
Zhang has now pleaded to the Chinese Football Association to BAN the Guangzhou R&F star from both the national team and his club as punishment for his behaviour. 
The Chinese football authorities are yet to comment on the allegations, but one thing's for sure... As 24 hours go, he's probably had some betters ones, eh? Like us on Facebook
